content.content: I am hoping someone smarter than me can explain their thoughts around the tradeoffs between buying $UNI directly and mining it via one of the pools. Is one cheaper overall? Will I get more $UNI for my money if I just purchase it directly? Is maxing my amount of owned $UNI even a good idea? I am thinking maybe mining is good because you get the interest + $UNI. Buying $UNI would be good to maximize owned $UNI? Any thoughts/insight appreciated.

It’s hard to really provide insights in what rewards mining will offer you at this point. It most likely depends on how much liquidity you provide in the pool & how much is provided in total, as rewards will be distributed evenly. There’s some good info under ‘liquidity mining’ here: https://uniswap.org/blog/uni/. Myself, I’m looking to purchase more $UNI in the near future. Most likely around $2-2.5, I’m expecting this to hit shortly as many people immediately try to cash out their ‘airdrop’. I can’t tell you which provides you better returns, can tell you that mining is most likely less risky as you’re not directly putting your capital at risk. You’d only be able to lose out on the swap rates (e.g. if you provide liquidity on USDT/ETH and ETH goes down in value).
This makes a ton of sense. Thanks.
No problem at all, good luck!

Powernoob here  Bought my first crypto this morning after staying up half the night to get accounts and and bunch of humdrum set up. STILL have no $UNI and running the regular workday now, can anyone help point the easiest way to get UNI with these ETH I just got. (Driving, eating, talking calls all while trying to remember email passwords for a bunch of new accounts in a completely new area of interest is getting me a little off my rocker lol) UNIpowerSWAPPER$ please! Come to my rescue

You could purchase UNI on Uniswap, Binance, KuCoin… whichever you prefer. Uniswap might be the easiest : https://uniswap.info/pair/0xd3d2e2692501a5c9ca623199d38826e513033a17. Or do you mean you want to claim the airdrop? As that can basically be done on any of the swap pages (top right corner), if you’ve used Uniswap before September 1st.

TMod_Marco:  Myself, I’m looking to purchase more $UNI in the near future. Most likely around $2-2.5, I’m expecting this to hit shortly as many people immediately try to cash out their ‘airdrop’.   Hihi. Seems that this didnt happen.

Buying it has a chance of higher returns in a very short term outlook but locking assets up in mining ASAP is what is going to be an insensitive for people to buy UNI. If anyone is in for the long term they’ll lose the power your votes have and the non-circulating and unstaked tokens can give people reason to believe this is another get rich scheme with no long term value. Using an exchange to buy UNI then transferring it to my wallet has been the cheapest and quickest way I’ve found for buying it.
Anoche entre en la minería a 0.48 uniswap a la semana ya comentaré el mes que viene si mereció la pena
